entities.name: promoting
entities.description: Government incentives aimed at encouraging renewable energy adoption.

entities.name: system
entities.description: A comprehensive framework integrating various components to facilitate the transition to renewable energy sources.

entities.name: climate goals
entities.description: Climate goals refer to specific targets or aspirations aimed at mitigating and adapting to climate change, often including reductions in greenhouse gas emissions.

entities.name: less visual impact
entities.description: Reduced visibility of infrastructure due to placement away from land.

entities.name: electricity demand
entities.description: The total amount of power used by individuals, businesses, and industries.

entities.name: biodiesel
entities.description: Biodiesel is a renewable fuel derived from plant oils and animal fats, used to reduce environmental impact in transportation.

entities.name: pumped hydro storage
entities.description: A method of storing energy by using water to create and store potential energy, which can later be converted back into electricity.

entities.name: Real-Time Adjustments
entities.description: The ability to make immediate changes in power distribution based on real-time data.

entities.name: solar
entities.description: Solar energy harnesses sunlight through photovoltaic cells to generate electricity.

entities.name: Offshore wind farms
entities.description: Promising renewable energy through high wind speeds and reduced visual impact.

entities.name: intermittency
entities.description: The unpredictable nature of solar and wind power availability.

entities.name: larger rotor diameters
entities.description: Larger rotor diameters are a technological advancement in wind turbines that increases the swept area and captures more wind energy, leading to higher efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

attributes.Effect on Efficiency: Increases efficiency by capturing more wind energy
attributes.Effect on Cost-Effectiveness: Improves cost-effectiveness of wind power generation

entities.name: economic opportunities
entities.description: Jobs, business growth, and financial benefits derived from renewable energy projects.

entities.name: improved efficiency

entities.name: bioenergy
entities.description: Bioenergy is organic material converted into biofuels, biogas, or used for heat and electricity generation.

entities.name: geothermal heat pumps
entities.description: Geothermal heat pumps are systems that use the earth's temperature to provide heating and cooling for buildings.

entities.name: DIGITALIZATION

entities.name: Global Electricity Demand
entities.description: The global electricity demand is the total amount of electrical energy consumed worldwide.

entities.name: energy

entities.name: energy storage technologies

entities.name: Natural Processes
entities.description: Natural processes are phenomena that occur in the natural world without human intervention.

entities.name: coal-fired power plants
entities.description: Coal-fired power plants are facilities that burn coal to produce heat and electricity. They have been a primary source of electricity generation but are being phased out due to environmental concerns.

entities.name: climate change
entities.description: The long-term rise in Earth's average surface temperature due to human activities and natural processes.

entities.name: turbines

entities.description: The backbone of electrical power distribution and transmission.

entities.name: wind

entities.description: Conventional energy sources include fossil fuels like coal, oil, and gas, alongside large-scale grid systems that primarily rely on these resources for power generation.

entities.name: energy security
entities.description: The protection of energy supply from disruptions due to external factors.

entities.name: environmental protection

entities.name: batteries
entities.description: Batteries are electrochemical devices that store electrical energy and release it as needed.

entities.name: waste biomass

entities.name: biogas
